com.cubeia.firebase.api.mtt.support.registry
Class PlayerRegistryImpl

java.lang.Object
  com.cubeia.firebase.api.mtt.support.registry.PlayerRegistryImpl
All Implemented Interfaces:
PlayerRegistry, PlayerRegistryImplMBean, Externalizable, Serializable
public class PlayerRegistryImpl
extends Object
implements PlayerRegistry, PlayerRegistryImplMBean, Externalizable

This class should be included in the tournament state since it holds all players and their current state.

This class automatically updates the system player registry.

Author:
Fredrik
See Also:

Method Detail

register

public MttRegisterResponse register(MttInstance instance,
                                    MttRegistrationRequest request)
Description copied from interface: PlayerRegistry

Registers a player for this tournament.

The player will only be registered if all interceptors return MttRegisterResponse.ALLOWED.

A player has only been registered in the tournament if the return value of is MttRegisterResponse.ALLOWED

If the player is already registered he will be re-registered and all listeners will be called.

Specified by:
register in interface PlayerRegistry
Parameters:
instance - the tournament instance
request - the context for the registration
Returns:
result of the registration
See Also:
com.cubeia.firebase.api.mtt.support.registry.PlayerRegistry#register(MttPlayer)

isRegistered

public boolean isRegistered(int pid)
Specified by:
isRegistered in interface PlayerRegistry

unregister

public MttRegisterResponse unregister(MttInstance instance,
                                      int pid)
Description copied from interface: PlayerRegistry

Unregisters a player from the tournament.

The player will only be unregistered if all interceptors returns MttRegisterResponse.ALLOWED.

A player has only been unregistered in the tournament if the return value is MttRegisterResponse.ALLOW

If the player is no registered nothing will happen but all listeners will be called. To override this behavior you must provide your own interceptor(s).

Specified by:
unregister in interface PlayerRegistry
Parameters:
instance - the tournament instance
pid - player id to unregister
Returns:
the result of the registration
See Also:
com.cubeia.firebase.api.mtt.support.registry.PlayerRegistry#unregister(int)

removePlayer

public void removePlayer(int pid)
Description copied from interface: PlayerRegistry
Removes a player from the registry, called when a player is out of the tournament. This method will not use any interceptor or call any listeners.

Specified by:
removePlayer in interface PlayerRegistry
Parameters:
pid - the player to remove
